bio:treatment.description: Plants 60–80 cm. Stems white to yellowish green, nearly leafless at flowering, densely tomentose. Leaves yellowish green; blades 1-nerved, filiform, 10–30 × 0.5–1.5 mm, faces glabrate. Involucres 8.5–12. Phyllaries 20–26, apices erect, acute, abaxial faces tomentose to glabrate. Corollas 7–10.9 mm, tubes puberulent, lobes 0.9–2 mm, glabrous; style appendages longer than stigmatic portions. Cypselae densely hairy; pappi 6.3–9.8 mm. 2n = 18.
Dry scrub Artemisia, pinyon, Atriplex, Joshua tree communities;
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety mohavensis may intergrade with vars. hololeuca and oreophila. It grows in southern Nevada and southern California.
